revision_note: Optimized from v1.0 — removed redundant cases, merged overlapping scenarios, focused on quality over count.

test_suites.description: Covers widget rendering across normal, slow, failed, and empty data conditions.

test_cases.title: All widgets render successfully on initial load and after page refresh
preconditions: User is logged in with Admin role
All backend APIs are operational
steps: Navigate to the Dashboard
Observe all widgets and confirm they render within 3 seconds
Press F5 to refresh the page
Observe all widgets again
test_cases.expected_result: All widgets fully render on both initial load and after refresh. No blank panels, stale data, or error states are visible.

test_cases.title: Widget shows loading state on slow network, error state on API failure, and recovers on retry
preconditions: User is on the dashboard
Ability to throttle network and mock API responses
steps: Throttle network to Slow 3G — confirm each widget shows a skeleton/spinner during fetch
Simulate a 500 error on the 'Sales Summary' API
Confirm the failed widget shows an isolated error message and all other widgets load normally
Restore the API and click 'Retry' on the failed widget
Confirm the widget recovers and displays data correctly
test_cases.expected_result: Widgets show spinners on slow load. A single widget failure shows an isolated error with a Retry option — other widgets are unaffected. Retry successfully reloads the widget.

test_cases.title: Widget displays empty state message when API returns no data
preconditions: API for 'Recent Orders' widget is mocked to return an empty array
steps: Navigate to the dashboard
Locate the 'Recent Orders' widget and observe its state
test_cases.expected_result: Widget renders a clear empty state UI (e.g., 'No data available') instead of a blank panel or runtime error.

test_suites.description: Covers correctness of KPI values, chart data points, percentage calculations, and real-time updates.

test_cases.title: KPI values, percentage changes, and chart data points match database records
preconditions: User is on the dashboard
Direct database access is available for verification
steps: Record all KPI card values: Total Revenue, Total Users, Orders Today, Conversion Rate
Record percentage change indicators on each KPI card (e.g., '+12% vs last month')
Hover over data points on Revenue Chart and User Activity Chart and note tooltip values
Query the database for the same metrics and time intervals
Compare all dashboard values against database results
test_cases.expected_result: All KPI values, percentage changes, and individual chart data points exactly match the database. No rounding errors or calculation discrepancies.

test_cases.title: Dashboard reflects a newly created record in real-time without requiring re-login
preconditions: User is on the dashboard with 'Orders Today' KPI and 'Recent Orders' widget visible
steps: Note the current 'Orders Today' count and top entry in 'Recent Orders'
Create a new order via the Orders module
Return to the dashboard and refresh (or wait for real-time update)
Observe both the 'Orders Today' KPI and the 'Recent Orders' widget
test_cases.expected_result: 'Orders Today' increments by 1. The new order appears at the top of the 'Recent Orders' widget. No re-login is required.

test_suites.description: Covers preset and custom date range filters, stacked filters, column sorting, reset, and filter persistence.

test_cases.title: Preset date range filter updates all dependent widgets with accurate data
preconditions: User is on the dashboard
Data exists across multiple date ranges
steps: Select 'Last 7 Days' from the date range filter
Verify all widgets reflect data for the last 7 days only and match database
Switch to 'Last 30 Days' and repeat the verification
test_cases.expected_result: Each widget updates correctly on filter change. Data is strictly scoped to the selected period and matches the database query for that period.

test_cases.title: Custom date range applies correctly and rejects an invalid range (start after end)
preconditions: User is on the dashboard with Custom Range filter available
steps: Select 'Custom Range', set start: 2026-02-01, end: 2026-02-15, and apply
Verify widgets show data only within Feb 1–15 and match the database
Now set start: 2026-02-20, end: 2026-02-10 (start after end) and attempt to apply
test_cases.expected_result: Valid range applies correctly — widgets show Feb 1–15 data only. Invalid range is rejected with: 'Start date cannot be after end date.' No widgets update.

test_cases.title: Stacked filters (date + region) narrow data correctly and stack without conflict
preconditions: Dashboard has both date range and region filters
Data exists for multiple regions and time periods
steps: Set date range to 'Last 30 Days'
Set region filter to 'North America'
Observe all widget data
Cross-check against database for North America records in the last 30 days
test_cases.expected_result: Widgets display data for North America in the last 30 days only. Both filters apply simultaneously. Result matches the database query with both conditions.

test_cases.title: Column sorting on 'Recent Orders' toggles correctly and filters persist across navigation
preconditions: Recent Orders widget is visible with at least 10 records
Date and region filters are applied
steps: Click 'Date' column header — verify descending order (newest first)
Click 'Date' again — verify ascending order (oldest first)
Click 'Amount' column header — verify ascending order (lowest first)
Navigate to Reports module and return to the dashboard
Verify all previously applied filters (date, region) are still active
test_cases.expected_result: Sort toggles correctly between ASC and DESC on each click. Sorted order matches the database. Applied filters persist after navigation.

test_cases.title: Reset filter clears all active filters and restores the dashboard to its default state
preconditions: User has applied 'Last 30 Days' and 'North America' filters
steps: Confirm widgets show filtered data
Click 'Reset Filters' or 'Clear All'
Observe the dashboard state and widget data
test_cases.expected_result: All filters are cleared. The dashboard reverts to defaults (e.g., 'Today', 'All Regions') and all widgets reload with the default dataset.

test_suites.description: Covers layout integrity across device breakpoints, chart scaling, and keyboard accessibility.

test_cases.title: Dashboard layout adapts correctly across all standard breakpoints with no horizontal scroll
preconditions: Browser devtools or real devices available for viewport simulation
steps: Open dashboard at 1920x1080 — verify multi-column grid, no overflow
Resize to 1366x768 — verify graceful column reduction
Resize to 768x1024 — verify 1-2 column stacking and touch-friendly controls
Resize to 375x812 — verify single-column layout and legible text
At each breakpoint, confirm no horizontal scrollbar appears
test_cases.expected_result: Layout adapts correctly at all breakpoints. Widgets stack appropriately, no content overflows, no horizontal scroll appears, and all text remains legible.

test_cases.title: Charts scale correctly on mobile and dashboard is fully keyboard navigable on desktop
preconditions: Dashboard is accessible on a 375px mobile viewport and a desktop browser
steps: On 375px viewport, verify Revenue Chart and User Activity Chart resize without clipping, overflow, or unreadable axis labels
Switch to desktop, use Tab key to navigate all interactive elements (filters, dropdowns, buttons)
Confirm visible focus indicators on each element and no keyboard traps exist
Use Enter/Space to activate controls and arrow keys for dropdown navigation
test_cases.expected_result: Charts scale and render legibly on mobile. All interactive elements on desktop are keyboard-accessible with clear focus states and no traps.

test_suites.description: Covers widget visibility by role, data scoping, backend API enforcement, and permission change propagation.

test_cases.title: Widget visibility is correctly scoped per role (Admin, Manager, Standard User, Viewer)
preconditions: Test accounts exist for each role: Admin, Manager, Standard User, Viewer
steps: Log in as Admin — verify all widgets including privileged ones (System Health, User Management Stats) are visible
Log in as Manager — verify only team-scoped widgets and data are shown; no company-wide metrics
Log in as Standard User — verify admin-only widgets (System Health, Revenue Chart) are hidden
Log in as Viewer — verify only public widgets (Public Announcements, Company Overview) are shown

roles.expected_scope: Team-level data only, no company-wide metrics

test_cases.expected_result: Each role sees only the widgets and data it is authorized to view. No role can access widgets or metrics above their permission level.

test_cases.title: Restricted widget API returns 403 on direct access attempt by an unauthorized user
preconditions: Standard User is logged in
Admin-only API endpoint is known
steps: As Standard User, make a direct GET request to /api/dashboard/system-health via Postman or browser devtools
Observe the HTTP response code and body
test_cases.expected_result: API returns HTTP 403 Forbidden with no data payload. Backend enforces access control independently of the UI.

test_cases.title: Permission grant and revocation reflect on the dashboard after refresh without re-login
preconditions: Standard User is logged in without access to 'Revenue Chart'
Admin session is available in a separate browser
steps: Confirm 'Revenue Chart' is not visible for Standard User
Admin grants 'Revenue Chart' access — Standard User refreshes — verify widget appears
Admin revokes the access — Standard User refreshes — verify widget disappears
test_cases.expected_result: Both grant and revocation of widget access are enforced on the next page refresh without requiring the user to log out. No stale permissions persist.

test_cases.title: Shared widget displays only the current user's own data — no cross-user data leakage
preconditions: User A and User B both have access to the 'Recent Orders' widget
Each user has a distinct set of orders in the system
steps: Log in as User A — record orders displayed in 'Recent Orders'
Log out and log in as User B — observe the same widget
Verify no User A orders appear in User B's view
test_cases.expected_result: Each user sees only their own records. No data from other users is exposed. Data isolation is enforced at the API level, not just the UI.

test_cases.title: Read-only user cannot modify widgets; zero-permission user sees a meaningful empty state
preconditions: Read-Only user account and a zero-permission user account both exist
steps: Log in as Read-Only user — attempt to click any Edit or Configure button on widgets
Confirm all edit controls are hidden or disabled and no changes can be saved
Log out and log in as the zero-permission user
Navigate to the dashboard and observe the page
test_cases.expected_result: Read-Only user cannot modify any widget. Zero-permission user sees: 'No widgets available. Please contact your administrator to request access.' No blank or broken UI.
